title: Bug 18934: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
OB: On build F2 (20020602) with Redhat 7.2 and GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only), when opening the ImageAnalyzer example, the scrollbars are enabled and movable, but they do not have any effect. Even when opening a small image, such as an icon, the scrollbars are misleading because they do not perform any action.
EB: In the ImageAnalyzer example, the scrollbars should be disabled to prevent them from being misleading and not having any effect.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Run build F2 (20020602) with Redhat 7.2 and GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only).
2. Open the ImageAnalyzer example.
3. Observe that the scrollbars are enabled and movable, despite not having any effect.
4. Open a small image, such as an icon, and notice that the scrollbars remain misleading without performing any action.
